DtBXKXsEAK_bU5u0okT1uQ.text: We visited Laduree in Harrods after recommendation to try the famous  Mont Blanc. I must say its the best thing ever! Do give it a try

ym49BtfgTRzOlHcWcKAscg.text: Stumbled into here by pure chance on an evening out at Covent Garden.Ironically, my friend and I had just come from Paris but had not visited Laduree there. Who knew we'd stop at one while in London?Great location if you're shopping around the market (though my friend and I stopped here in the evening when most of the shops had already closed. Luckily, Laduree was still open).Bought a box of 12 macarons. DELICIOUS flavors. My favourite one was probably the salted caramel one. Mmmmmm...Macarons are on the pricey side (then again, macarons were quite pricey in Paris as well), but totally worth the tasting experience.

87X9w6RrEj_Y5sZhSQOYKA.text: My friend introduced me to this place when I went to study abroad in England. The atmosphere of this place was quite friendly. The people there were very helpful and I loved that even if you buy one macaroon, they give you a special clear bag to put it in. It's like they prize each and every macaroon that goes out. In my opinion, it's on the pricey side..one, I believe, was like 1.60 GBP which is around 2.60 USD. Because no one really just gets one, it ends up adding up. Those boxes that they give it to you in if you buy 6 and up are pretty pricey as well.I'll admit that I wasn't hooked when I first tried it. I tried the pistachio and thought it was good but not all that great. I decided to give it one more try and ended up getting the chocolate one. That is when I got HOOKED. Even as I think about it now, my mouth is watering. It's excellent. When I ever go back, I'm definitely coming back here.

30XnN5L0-B-Rxfa3O4Czfg.text: To see some pictures of the pretty macaroons please go to my blog:hungryinlondon.com/2011/…  On a sunny and warm afternoon in the middle of Covent Garden it is usually very difficult to get a table somewhere. Surprisingly not at Laduree, which might have to do with their rather astronomical prices for cakes, ice cream and of course its famous macaroons. Laduree is a French luxury tea room chain which has two more subsidiaries in London, the most famous being at Harrods. I don't have a particular sweet tooth so I managed to turn 32 without ever having tried macaroons. The Skinny Bib took it into his culinary hands to introduce me to his favourite sweet snack. For people who are as ignorant as me regarding pastries, macaroons are meringue like cookies with a cream filling. You can get them in loads of different flavour-varieties at Laduree such as chocolate, coffee, lemon, coconut, praline and pistachio among others. We tried the raspberry ( the pink ones, very nice), the salty caramel (too sweet for me, did not get much of the salt), the vanilla (the best by far!) and the green apple (which I didn't get to taste anymore because I was in a sugar coma at this point). Mini macaroons cost you 1.80 each and the normal sized ones 3.90. We also had to try one of the cakes, this very elaborate piece of multi-layered chocolate cake was very pretty, extremely chocolaty, incredibly rich and very expensive (6-7). On the upside you can probably share this piece between 4 and still be sated. There was coconut ice cream and passion fruit sorbet hidden below this huge amount of whipped cream (excusez moi, creme chantilly). Nice, but nothing to write home about. You can't beat the location, particularly on a sunny day and it is THE place to take your parents when they visit for a weekend. Will I be a regular customer? Very likely not as I would have to invest in a new wardrobe a couple of sizes bigger at the same time. I don't think macaroons, as lovely as they are, are quite worth this.

JGHamkH5S7yefCAfRFK2jw.text: Laduree has always had it's golden little store in Piccadilly and a concession in Harrods but now we are lucky enough to have a restaurant/tea room/terrace to frequent. And boy what a sweet treat. Set in the heart of Covent Garden, on the corner of luxe feeling 'market place' one can easily find this haven of sweet offerings and delights. Downstairs lays the counter of dreams. Lined with an exquisite spectrum of macaroons and pastries. Ice creams are also available with mini macaroons on top in sumptuous flavours. All can be taken away or gift wrapped (obvos not le ice cream). Being a Laduree connoisseur, I headed upstairs to the tea rooms and terrace area. Greeted by a very Parisian style bar and a matre d, we were offered any table we liked, which sadly didn't include the terrace as this is only for people eating lunch. It didn't really cause upset as inside was delightfully decorated to perfection. We chose to sit beneath a canopy of white silk, on a plumped up velvet sofa. The room is all fireplace, marble, ornate and Louis VI style. Cockatoo printed wallpaper, baby blue wooden panelling, gold leaf and just general loveliness. Tables are small but neatly styled with crockery and the like. Menu was extensive for a tearoom and took me and Legs 11 ages to decipher what to have. Settled on iced mint tea and raspberry, strawberry/mint and blackcurrant/lavender macaroons. Utter mouth sex. Loved. Wanted all the flavours but had little to no monies left after this splurge. And a spend it is but oh so worth it. I will dine soon. Which brings me to say, there is an outside, heated/covered area in the main piazza to dine in as well but you might as well come upstairs if you are as its much more special. Service was excellent and not as French and rude as one would expect. They are all French though. Bogs were a huge let down though. Expected a servant type attendant to hand me and towel etc. Nope, one loo. But I forgave this.

0IbaeP2ZAHYjAV6Ilh_fJw.text: Obviously if you like Macaroons then you will love this little shop. Fantastic flavours and great variety. They have beautiful little boxes to make up gifts. World famous for a reason!

hX-_k3IWS7fxCwFjByNAaA.text: I'm a savoury person. I don't really like macaroons. But I like Ladurée's macaroons. A lot.

0ILupJUMUKgZuCqhWrFLXg.text: The cafe menu was quite reasonable: I paid around GBP10 for 3 macarons and a cup of latte. Not bad for London! Will be back for more macarons :)

vE49cVt2unTLRRzKlmO_9Q.text: Excellent macaroons, Parisian tea house experience.  Delicious hot chocolate.  Expensive, but to be expected in Covent Garden.  Perfect for a girl's brunch.

9SW1xnuB82SvgCmxeFVg1Q.text: It can't get any better than Ladureé. I bake macarons at home and know the difficulty level of them. This location is so cute and tiny and close to wonderful shopping, not to mention the apple store right across the way. Anyway, back to the Macarons!My fave include: Rose, ORANGE BLOSSOM (Melt in your mouth goodness), The grape-cinnamon is a new flavour and quite delicious, Vanilla is a staple, the coconut is good, but too subtle, you can barely taste the coconut unless you get a bit of it in a bite. The staff is friendly, but even if they were mean it wouldn't matter because the macarons are so tasty I would probably go through a gauntlet in order to eat them. The cute little boxes they give you is also pretty adorable and perfect to take away and continue about your day. I Heart you Ladureé!

1gTADOL1HeR_AvZtRibM3Q.text: Ladurée is good anywhere, but what I especially love about this one is that you can sit on the terrace and look at all the street performers doing their thing down in Covent Garden while eating yourself into a diabetic coma. **It really helps when someone else is paying for your countless glasses of champagne and pastries.**Also the staff here is so so amazing, they always supply me with pens when I wanto draw aliens on the paper-top tablecloth. Nothing but love for those french guys.

p_1LMwpV6GQlsH_whfn2kw.text: Macaroons are good.  I enjoy the rose petal flavor.  I didn't care for the lack of service.  I bought the macaroons and wanted to enjoy them upstairs, but was told that I can't go upstairs because I bought the macaroons to go.  Well, I didn't ask for them 'to go', she just put them in a bag.  Now, I am not allowed to go upstairs. If there are rules about how it's to be packaged affecting whether I could go up to enjoy it or not, why not have a sign or ask me??  Photos are also not allowed.  Seriously?  These are pastries, not the crown jewels.  Get REAL!  Very Annoying.

GnR2NqvfWxgAUzGjplKAfw.text: 14 hour layover in London? First Stop - Ladurée. I've been waiting patiently across the Atlantic for the day to come - the day I can finally experience the finest macaron of it's class - a Ladurée macaron. To say that I had high expectations - would be an absolute understatement. I had the Mt. Everest of expectations. I expected everything from this one bite-sized pretty patty and nothing less of an eye-widening, finger gripping orgasm that would send the loudest of silent screams straight to the moon and back again. It's safe to say...My first bite in to that caramel flavored macaron... was NOTHING.. and EVERYTHING  all at once. On June 20th, while standing upon the worn steps of Convent Garden... I fell in love. The texture, the filling, the flavor - it was perfect, it was harmonious, it was LOVE. The patisseries of Ladurée are the composers, and the macarons were their symphonies. For I am only disappointed.. that I can't frequent Ladurée often. How am I to ever look at macarons the same way again..

NvAGheA2zwOgII-lKsIACQ.text: My lovely host for the day and I ended our tour de London in Covent Garden.We passed by this adorable bakery/restaurant and had to come back for tea after our walk. I am a regular drinker of tea these days and love to have it at night with a pastry.The macaroons at Laduree are fantastic. SOOO delicious. We tried Chocolate, Raspberry, Coconut, Coffee, Lemon and Pistachio. It was so cute, we each took little bites from all of them. We had to try them all! I was so lucky to have the Coffee one for breakfast the next day and Lemon I was able to smuggle it on the plane with me to NYC. Service was really good and they allowed me to take a place mat with me as a souvenir. I can't wait to use it at my next tea party! Too bad I won't have their macaroons!

7SR4ReMPnzHiOHGabYMZ3w.text: Best macarons I've had yet!! I couldn't bring myself to buy a box for over £12 so I decided to grab two of my favorite flavors: raspberry and pistachio. The raspberry was light and perfectly textured with the right amount of jamminess to it. It tasted amazing and by far the best raspberry macaron I've tasted since it was so fresh. The pistachio flavor was also very distinct and you could tell it was made from real pistachios rather than artificial flavoring. Simply amazing!The shop itself is very small but is very well presented. It looks like I've found my new favorite brand for macarons!

Kr6pfV8I74r9HrszIYELKw.text: How could I live in London and NOT go to Laduree???Bought a box of 8 macarons which I devoured in one sitting while reading The Economist. Such a fantastic way to consume unnecessary calories and gain weight :)

4WIODOBBGz7M9oo3rTcgXA.text: Laduree and Pierre Herme are hands down THE places to go to for macarons so if you happen to be in London when the cravings hit, I don't see why you would go anywhere else.My favorite one I've tried is the rose and then second would have to be blackcurrant violet. Definitely recommend both!

lP-PXyD8y9Z6gCE28NZUmQ.text: Ah, another lovely Laduree!Fantastic spot to enjoy a cup of fabulous tea and nibble on wonderful macaroons... heaven! The patio area provides plenty of people watching entertainment, the indoor area is a lovely romantic place to hide, and the balcony oozes "exclusivity", silver service in the clouds while you overlook the entertainers and shoppers below.While the menu is pricey, do as the french do and enjoy their offerings in moderation... a pot of tea and a macaroon is all i need.

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom

99rLV5KJPEVR7jIhTrP1_w.text: I was ECSTATIC to learn that Laduree would open in Covent Garden when I was studying abroad. Afterall, they're the originator of the macaron! Although they're quite pricey, the macarons are always a lovely treat to enjoy in moderation. Perfect texture, color, and taste (not too sweet or artificial). They're probably the best I've had, and I couldn't not bring them back to the States for my mom to try. My flat mate, who didn't initially like macarons, was converted in part thanks to Laduree! :) I've also tried the eclairs, which were also delicious (not too sweet, stiff or soggy) and had gold specks!The location is perfect (in the midst of shops and hustle and bustle) and the interior, although small, is just gorgeous. It's really a quaint, cute place. The service was also friendly and polite, and I never really felt rushed even when there was a line. Too bad there aren't any Ladurees in the States, but I guess it's another reason for me to go back to Europe!

S_nUOJcGpVEYlM0SiPg3ow.text: When coming to Covent Garden, my husband and I make it a point to go to Laduree, pick up a few of their perfect macarons and go for a walk. It's something I look forward to and relish. There's always a glowing picture in my mind of us walking through Covent Garden, watching street performers and people shopping, walking through the crowds and feeding eachother those tiny, light bits of heaven...Onto the flavors.I'm a die-hard macaron fan, but not a snob. I'll try any macaron once, and more than a million times if it's done right. Having just been treated to a box of Paul's macarons, we couldn't resist stopping by Laduree to have some more. We were greeted briefly (amongst a crowd) and picked up just enough to keep us hungry before dinner. We sampled the Ginger Yuzu (yummy, but could use a bit more ginger), pink peppercorn (just enough bite and spice without being attacking your palate with pepper), gingerbread (the smell enough sends me back to my childhood in Michigan during Christmas), and rose petal (which was thankfully not too fragrant). We took them to go, but observed plenty of people seated and enjoying themselves under a tent outside the shop. Maybe next time we'll stay, but the idea of a long walk and a Laduree bag in hand is too good to resist.

wfK_H3tPrj1sHZq86vmjGA.text: When I worked at the Royal Opera House a few summers ago I would always come in here after work and get treats for me and my flatmate. What a gorgeous shop and what delicious desserts. Friendly and attentive service. Love this place. Hands down one of the best places in London to "treat yo self!"

7j3Obf8PWerFtiuzDQ_59A.text: As much as I love their macarons and their food is quite good the service (at the restaurant above the shop) on our recent visit the service was absolutely terrible. We were with our 2 children. It took 30 minutes to get their juice and the water we ordered arrived after that without so much as bread or an apology. It was close to an hour before we had any food. No one checked in with us or seemed to care despite more than adequate staff given the number of patrons. The French girl who came to take our credit card asked how everything was, we mentioned the service and she smiled. I guess she did not understand the word "dreadful".

jQNh7wnZUleh7blYdWb5Rg.text: I think this is the newest branch on Laduree's and what a brilliant location, well, for me, because they're such perfect perfumed (pricy) presents. (ALLITERATION!) and I can just pick a few and go home with goodies in my bag to present to my adoring crowds. (I lied, not crowds, nor that adoring...my brothers who are kind of vicious when i bring food home O_O) It's quite a small store front for macarons for takeaway but there is a cafe upstairs that i haven't ventured up to yet. Taste wise, I prefer Pierre Hermes from Selfridges more. I find Laduree's a little bit too sweet but they're certainly the most fragrant out of the two patisseries.

RFVPlluRCTVuklGR6UNuUg.text: A terrace in the middle of Covent Garden, in the sun, with macarons... What is there not to love? Friendly and professional staff, incredible macarons, even more amazing desserts. It comes from a born and raised french girls, so I know all about those pastries, and they are amazing! Really recommend it, you cannot regret it!

_WsYI7R_7RIeMcT8Oz02CA.text: Lovely tea room atmosphere and you've got to love the macaroons of course!I suggest if you're in the neighbourhood - do go and check it out! Comfy velvet sofas and cute little tables, all in nice pastel colours - a must for an afternoon desert - or - for a post dinner post drinks desert on a Friday night (yep, the place is open late!)I would also strongly recommend going for the seating upstairs - they've got heaters and what could be better on a gloomy day if it isn't for a great cuppa of their exotic teas and delicious (hat off for their hazelnut mille feuille cake) deserts while overlooking one of the greatest areas in London (hint, hint - Covent Garden)?

FAGM-O_Z-HSyAfsPgKKMBg.text: Great macarons.  Apparently they also serve food, but that's not why you come to Laduree.  It's open early and closes late, so come during off hours or you'll face a decent line.

sWTU4m1c4-GGZuXjeKwaTQ.text: Popped in after having dinner in Soho on a Saturday night - we were wanting macaroons, coffee/tea, and not a big crowd. Laudree definitely hit all those marks, but it was (unsurprisingly) pricy and touristy.

YlL5P_5Y_LiD1WoQ-SuGsw.text: My first experience with Laduree was on a rainy afternoon in Paris. My friend (who has lived in Paris) told me about their wonderful macarons and suggested that I go while I was there for a couple of days. We picked up a pack of twelve. We had a few then, and they were wonderful.We wandered around Paris, and we saw some great new things (even though it was raining incredibly hard). We wandered to Montmartre and saw the steps in Amelie as well as the cafe from Amelie. (It was a very Amelie day.) Later in the afternoon we finished the macarons, and while they had melted, they were still amazing.Then I find out there are several Laduree stores in London. I've been to the Covent Garden store a couple of times to pick up macarons. While the macarons are still wonderful, there is just something different about them than they are in Paris. Maybe it's just traveling in Paris and being there that makes them taste so different. While I can completely recommend these delicious treats to anyone, I would also recommend more to go to Paris and have them there.

f0IZtxS7icQ7lGGi7fp9fQ.text: Had a happy accident of stumbling on this place in the midst of a little shopping in Covent Garden.  Hurrah!Glorious macaroons, just as good as I remember when I had them at their New York shop: just a bit crunchy cookie, with fillings that pack an incredible flavor punch each time.  Really enjoyed that pear flavor they had this time - imaginative and delicious.Still my all-time favorite macaroon.  Cannot wait for another chance meeting with these treats...

14PK7PAZKy0mLxm7pj5-cg.text: In my humble opinion, just as everything else, there are pros and cons. Pros: tasty, sexy, beautifully presented, nice selection. Cons: a little difficult to find (GPS stopped around the block and we had to walk all around to locate it), pricey. I get it, it's French, it's posh, but what is really their profit margin?  All in all, we got a take out (take away, as they say in London). It was cool, but wouldn't spend that kind of money again.

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom

YBo4yrWJFuqgty0EMUtGfg.text: I love this place better since the view of the outside is so good and the desserts are perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom

A-w2dQG4SyAIzL7nWG3J6A.text: Authentic french macarons. Went here twice on my trip.  First time I ordered several.  Great service disappointed many of the macaroons were cracked.  Second visit macarons to take home. Service disappointed as they tried to serve others before me while I waited patiently.  Macarons seem to be in better shape.

u27O-6hJIBh45jSIK40wqw.text: The best macaroons. its reputation precedes itself. The ones london taste the same and are the same quality as in paris

haNFvNIuDWeCHammqIRvyQ.text: First of all, I'd like to say that I have limited exposure to macarons (I've tried them from perhaps five different places), and I'm not their biggest fan (I don't have a large sweet tooth, and they're mostly sugar). That being said, Laduree's are the tastiest I've had by far. I didn't actually go to Laduree myself. My brother was backpacking in Europe, and right before he came home from London, he bought a dozen of Laduree's macarons to bring home for us. He told us we should eat them all that night, because after 24 hours, they start going stale. He put them in the fridge as soon as he got home, and he told us we were supposed to wait 10 minutes after taking them out of the fridge before eating them. We did not wait the prescribed 10 minutes. We waited about two or three minutes. He bought a variety of flavors, so we cut them up and each had a taste. Some of those flavors included caramel, melon (limited time summer flavor), Marie Antoinette tea, raspberry, chestnut, vanilla, rose petal, and pistachio. I was quite pleased with the various flavors and fillings. None of them was artificial tasting (I've had orange that was, and it was disgusting). The maracons (outside of the filling), were quite soft. I was surprised. We tried five flavors before we stopped, because they were quite sweet. My mom and I had the rest of them two days later (after they had supposedly gone stale), and we actually enjoyed them more than we had the first time. We ate them straight out of the fridge, and we agreed that they tasted less sweet, which we appreciated. I also liked that the macarons were slightly less soft and chewy, and more crisp.I can't say I'll go to Laduree myself, because I have no immediate plans to travel to Europe, but should someone bring some more back for me, I'm game to try more flavors!

Ob7-0dBqs42ylKDdnCUNpA.text: When  criticising,  you take into consideration many factors such as price, location, atmosphere, quality of food and ingredients ( this part also separated by other factors), atmosphere, service, customer portfolio. Criticisers background also affect the review. It's hard yes but you try to be objective. Unfortunately I have two bad experiences with Ladurée-Covent Garden. Last time I called them up for a reservation of 5 ( inc a baby). I'd like to book for afternoon tea but lady told me that only lunch reservations are taken. Ok! I said my guests might be interested of having lunch but I'm not quite sure and I don't want to sit outside due to having a baby. She was kind enough to say she will speak to the staff to arrange a table. When we arrived to the place a member of staff told us that he is aware of my call and showed our table. My guests also agreed to have lunch. After a minute he said "sorry but I have to arrange this table who booked for lunch. They suppose spend £30 each". He asked to leave the table and wait for 10-15 mins with our baby outside!!! I do not want to mention how much  afternoon tea menu was What's the difference from lunch menu etc. I'm not a person that who is willing to give one star. But after all experience this place deserves no more than this. So, how nicely designed the place, how nice their display or how beautiful their macarons do not matters.  I've been to all Ladurée s in London and Paris. I haven't seen any  ignorant or bad management in any of the other. They have lots to learn!

C9iE37bhh6df9pWsUnOOKQ.text: There is not much to say but : amazing! My friend and I went there during our London weekend trip and had such a great time. Well, it's a bit pricy but it's all worth it I can promise. Both of us ordered the Afternoon Tea which comes comes on a high etagere and offers a lot of different sweets but also sandwiches. Of course we got some tea which was really nice too. The servants were extremely nice and helpful and seemed to be really professional as they spoke plenty of different languages. I was so impressed. Also the surrounding was beautiful so that we had a really pleased stay. Would totally come again and buy some more delicious macarons!

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom

Q7CeOr6AK9fEtMXoht9DbA.text: The finest French macarons in London. Period. End of discussion.JK I'll say a bit more :)I came here to resuscitate myself after a loooong trip at the Apple Genius Bar. I indulged my inner fat kid and bought a set of seven macarons. Each bite drew me closer to heaven, I swear! I highly highly highly recommend the salted caramel macaron. That sweet + salty combination is unbeatable. The cafe itself is super cute and dainty. I think next time I return, I'll stay a while and order afternoon tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom

WOATQqf_vtYhlETq7Whgrg.text: My absolute weakness, Laduree macarons! This location is quaint and small, but not a long line luckily. They had flavors the Paris shop did not have like chocolate coconut marshmallow (delicious!) and had the pineapple macaron that I had so wanted to try!

v7vHxV6zax_-6upPIFyjwA.text: Macarons are really delicious. Laudree's macarons are particularly delicious. Their shop in Paris is really lovely and when my sister and I were in Covent Garden and saw the Laudree shop there, we knew we had some memories to relive. If this review was just about macaron, it would be like seven stars. They're really delicious and come in beautiful and creative flavours. I was, however, severely turned off by the snooty salesman who was obviously irritated when we ended up getting too many to fit in a paper bag (he hadn't asked us how many we wanted to begin with).  For a place that charges so much for tiny little (albeit heavenly and tasty) baked goods, I would expect a little more courtesy I guess...especially since we were buying more. It was generally weird. It didn't stop us from inhaling our macarons.

tWMXSDObEqV8Wg_47Hs3jg.text: Thank God these macarons aren't cheap otherwise I'd be obese! There are that good.I went to Laduree in Paris and had to find one in London. I love this location. The restaurant is upstairs and usually quite busy but the wait is never too long. There's outdoor seating with heaters but it does get quite chilly so bundle up in the colder weather. The views over Covent Garden are lovely.Inside is decorated like a  storybook and I love meeting friends here for tea/coffee and dessert. The Coupe Ispahan is the dessert that I am absolutely hooked on! Its not cheap but its nice to have on special occasions. Even though dinner here can add up there are 2 and 3 course specials that are more than worth it for the experience alone.

PtiO_ByoDHsfw15BxFcktw.text: I love this location of Laduree in London! It's perfect for those in Central London near Holborn, etc. Close to LSE and King's College.The cafe is set up to be inside and outside. The area to just purchase macaroons is insanely crowded. The doors are hard to get through when two people try to go in and out at the same time. They have all the flavors, but not always all of the different variety of boxes.If you aren't a fan of the prices, Paul is owned by Laduree. Go down the street and buy one there!

tPRLm5mL9PitXWlhd4F65g.text: Quite pricey and located in one of the more touristy areas of London, but the macarons are delicious: not too sweet, perfect texture, interesting flavours. Be prepared to queue in the tiny shop if you are just purchasing macarons, but other than that, give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom

yRANobXOEPSO06KMYlzf4g.text: Very slow and confused service .Great macaroons but mediocre food otherwise.Nothing like real Laduree in Paris

1IY4wDtF_PNrVWDj46xOIg.text: If you're looking for somewhere for a quick sweet treat then look no further than Ladurée in Covent Garden.This is the patisserie's first stand-alone tea salon in the capital, serving savoury snacks and champagne as well as sweet treats and those signature macarons. I popped in a couple of weeks ago before dance class to enjoy some of their famous macarons and take in the beautiful surroundings.Given its location it can be fairly busy so you may need to wait for a table but trust me when I say it will be worth the wait. This is a luxury establishment with a traditional decor that enhances your experience. They also have an outdoor terrace which I'm sure is wonderful in the summer months for a spot of people watching!I didn't want anything too heavy before my class so I didn't go for anything savoury instead choosing to try their delightfully thick hot chocolate and two of their mini macarons; petale de rose and Strawberry Guimauve (that's rose petal and strawberry marshmallow to you and me) but more on those later.The hot chocolate at Ladurée is seriously thick, almost like you're drinking melted chocolate. It's silky smooth and slightly bitter as it's made with only the best quality dark chocolate so if you have a sweet tooth you might not enjoy this. It comes in a tiny silver pot almost like a milk jug and there's more than enough for two cups in each one so it's possible to share. For some reason I haven't quite figured out hot chocolate with cream is cheaper than without but it is in fact the exact same hot chocolate recipe. Go figure!Now on to the macarons!Traditionally macarons are matured for two days and you can tell when they are at their freshest as when you pinch it between your forefinger and thumb they bounce rather than crack. Rose, violet or lavender are usually my go to flavours so I thoroughly enjoyed the rose petal one which was lovely and light without being overpowering but the star was the strawberry marshmallow. As you leave why not pick up a couple extra from the counter to take away with you?

dOi1AwW_8MVSORgSXOVxbA.text: LOVE. THIS. PLACE. Even though this place is kind of pricey (1.80 pounds per macaron) I will DEFINITELY be coming back. I had already heard amazing things about Laduree beforehand, but I didn't truly grasp the meaning of "amazing" until I tried their macarons today. I ended up getting one pistachio and one marie antoinette - and both were absolutely phenomenal. The shells were the perfect mix of crunchy and soft, and the filling was amazing for both - although I did like the marie antoinette a tad bit more. But seriously, they were the best macarons I've every had. Literal bites of heaven. If you're in the area, you MUST visit this place.

qIoASgvnPvoaoZ3fKap0QA.text: As lovely and delicious as these historic macarons are -- and I assure you that those little delectable treats are worth the price -- the service here is just terrible for the price point involved and I can no longer give this particular location my business.Let me start by saying that there is absolutely no bad flavour to get here.  They are all incredible.  Particularly the caramel with sea salt.  Wow.  Loved the seasonal chocolate flavour, as well as the pistachio.  But the counter service is bad, the staff is ignorant, the tea service is ugh, etc.  Were it just for the food, Laduree would get all of my 5 happy stars.  Alas..._______________Read on for anything but macarons:1.  The woman at the macaron counter would not give me her stapler so I could attach my receipt to the gift box I was getting.  Weird.2.  The same woman was confused about the special gift boxes available to be packed with assortments.  And she had no recommendations as to what flavours I should put in the box.  I also felt her attitude was quite condescending.3.  Perhaps I'm just a rude American with no manners, but it really is odd that you cannot eat your macarons in the outdoor patio, once you have paid for them inside at the counter.  Rather, you must buy the macarons at the table, which are then brought to you on a plate.  I was not told this rule when I told a Laduree employee inside, during my macaron purchase, that I intended to enjoy some tea outside with my tasty treats.  And I was not told this rule while I ordered tea with the expressed intention of drinking it alongside my sweet macaron snack.  It wasn't until after I had my tea placed in front of me that I was told of this "rule."  I did feel quite duped by this whole situation.4.  You cannot sit upstairs on the balcony unless you are getting the full tea service.  There must have been some miscommunication here when another employee (inside at the counter again) told me that I could "definitely" sit upstairs, and I could easily just ask an attending waiter as to my seating preference.  It was not very busy at all and I'm still puzzled by this policy.5.  The ambiance is lacking.  A cheap show is always rousing up some noise outside.  So the soothing pastels and calming notion of sipping quality teas does absolutely nothing to distract you from the tacky jugglers heckling the public when they don't get enough "donations" for a "quality" show.  Not to mention that one of the heated awnings is broken.  And the seating by the roped partitions is tight (forcing you to jump the ropes in order to leave your table if you don't want to awkwardly brush up against a stranger).  I do not intend to eat or drink here in the future.6.  This seems a bit obvious, since the macarons ARE Laduree's selling point, but ONLY the macarons are worth it.  They are the only good thing served here.  The other desserts and treats here are lacking... significantly.  A £7 cupcake with "pistachio icing and blackcurrant filling" stuck to the wrapper, was dry and crumbly, and flavourless despite the description.  Supersuper disappointed in one of the most expensive cupcakes of my life.7.  Lastly, I had dirty silverware.  That pretty much solidified the terrible experience for me.

zfEXuRsahcddtHwuZCN2mg.text: We had afternoon tea here while on holiday in March. We ordered two pots of tea (one for me, one for my sweetie) and one order of the sandwiches & pastries. You get two sandwiches, two pastries, two desserts, and two macarons, each of your choice. This (one order) was plenty of food for us. The atmosphere was relaxed with attentive service. The restaurant seating is upstairs and cozy.

s0FenxUllSH326i23ZtIpQ.text: Fab macarons in a gorgeous setting!!! It's so feminine and classy and you can watch the crowds of Covent Garden from the beautiful terrace.

w9JmwQmdNVQPIvtYXjaWkw.text: My expectations were higher than the peaks of a meringue for Laduree.  Verdict: there are some sizeable pros (in mini form), but my waistline and I are not hurrying back.Macarons are an indulgence.  I've tried making them at home before, and know that they require skill beyond what I can muster.  You pay accordingly; good macarons are not cheap.  Arguably, at Laduree, you are also paying for "the experience": prim and proper staff behind the glass case, perfectly arranged boxes, a flavour menu, a tea room formality, tourists taking photos from the sidewalk because they want to forever remember the lines of sugary rainbows (I felt like a celebrity in there!  Get my good angles, tourists, as I stand in front of the display case!).  I bought 6 macarons for roughly 12 pounds.  The tissue paper, insert about Laduree flavours and sticker sealing my bounty were all nice touches.The macarons themselves?  They were good.  My favourite, surprisingly, was the humble vanilla: the sugary meringue and the rich vanilla bean filling was so powerfully flavoured with authentic vanilla flavour.  In both the raspberry and the cassis/violet (jelly fillings), however, the filling peeled away from the meringue.  The chocolate macaron had a brittle shell (old?  Too dry?) that cracked as soon as my teeth touched it.  I know I'm a tough grader when it comes to Laduree, but my standards are skewed in relation to the cost per unit.  Yelp note: the Laduree boxes are beautiful and, even though they once housed macarons, they now hold trinkets and rings around my apartment.  Laduree eye candy 24/7; that's how we do.

o2g19kjHbJ4t-XyACMmBsA.text: My friends and I visited UK back in September and both of them really want to try out the afternoon tea, therefore, we went to Laduree to try out the its afternoon tea. We ordered 3 different types of afternoon teas (finger food, cake, and macaroons) and the waiter messed up our order 3 times..... They gave us the wrong amount of finger food, wrong flavor of cakes and macaroons..... Not sure what was the reason. Personally I think their dessert it's more on a sweeter side (way too sweet for my friends (both girls are big sweet tooth and still too sweet for them) and I). Overall, the quality of the taste is there, but I wouldn't go again unless my other friends want to try it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom

hb6aWTEZwDHcZkdhDpJVzg.text: Tea party, girlie afternoon, classy hen do - Laduree fits the bill for each of these.I caught up at Laduree with a friend post lunch. She managed to get us a table on the terrace with less than 5 minutes of waiting on a Friday afternoon. Brilliant!Love their macarons of course. I had the caramel and pistachio macarons with fresh grapefruit juice. On another day I would have had a coffee but it was a particularly hot (and rare) summer day so I was surviving on a potion of iced water and juice. The pistachio macaron was yummy. Caramel macaron was good as well but didn't hold ground compared to the pistachio. Nice amount of crunch and soft. I had read reviews about snobby service but I had a great experience with the staff..they were friendly and fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom. Pistachio and caramel macarons

Zs0xqItwDg0tbv8YFbiUWA.text: It's a small location but with outdoor seating (for a rare sunny summer day).  Wait staff is pleasant and definitely faster than the Harrods location.  They have a full menu for before/after the theatre.  Between all the locations in London, I rotate between this and Harrods. They are the only 2 with a full menu (that i know of).

7Hzanskzy7yOApjoBqJ6fw.text: Ladurée changed my opinion about macarons. I used to dislike macarons because they are dry and overly sweet. Then I went to Ladurée (in NYC) and realize the ones I had before were just poorly made macarons. But in Ladurée, the flavours and textures are lovely. They are still pretty sweet but it's in a more delicate and complex way that's actually enjoyable. Came here for the afternoon tea set on the terrace and that wasn't a great idea on a winter day. It was a bit too cold, and the sun was glaring into my eyes. The service was quite slow, and like many yelpers mentioned it could be a bit more friendly. While the desserts are lovely, it was just too much sugar to consume in one sitting. I'd come back here for the macarons but not the tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon tea

VWkcdTqsrlnhpBecIMmIqw.text: I absolutely love this place in Paris and LondonIt's amazing The chocolate drink The chocolates, everything Beautiful presence, staff is friendly Just brought home some  lavender white chocolate barsMy family was hesitant at first It popped in our mouths Fantastic The lavender was excellent I'll be visiting the store in NYC to purchase favors for my child's christening party! I'm excited The ones in Paris are lovely as well

KrnKBPu9et2ydiMYnCGsTg.text: Now I've been to Laduree in old Pari and enjoyed a tea but mainly enjoyed the macaroonsHowever my friend and I fancied a tea and chat while in Covent Garden and we decided to try hereWe didn't actually get anything to eat and they didn't mind which was niceThe decor is so cute and pretty and it also has a balcony outside. It's very light inside and we were sat straight awayThe menu of cakes and sandwiches does look amazing - quite steep though but would be a nice treatOur teas were obviously more than your normal cuppa but were really tasty and served with lovely teapots and cupsI would definitely pop in for a chat and tea with a girl friend if in CG!

fhtnwkN-f_PKGRY_p3uvXg.text: The wife and I have been to a couple locations in both Paris and England and all of them have been outstanding.  We stopped in for High tea and were seated rather quickly around 3pm.  We will definitely go back for high tea during our next trip to London!

ZOevVIuFuDhjLH3SnRcjtw.text: Very poor, so disappointing. I ordered a club sandwich and fries: sandwich was small and soggy, with one tiny scrap of burnt bacon laid on top of it - essentially a chicken and mayo sandwich for £18+. The fries were completely cold and, when I complained, the waiter took them away, only to return the _same_ fries to me moments later with extra salt added. The chef obviously did not care about the quality of food they were sending out to customers. This place has a great name for macaroons, and is in a prime spot, but is best avoided if you want anything other than coffee & sweets.

MmwbNFG_HErlmXupAyGp1A.text: Laduree boasts the best macaroons in town and from past experience of buying a box here and there I have always found them to be delicious. I had not yet though been for the full tea and macaroons evening so I was quite happy when my best friend suggested we go there for tea on my birthday. Being a total girl for a minute, I am a huge sucker for pastel tea cups, vintage decor and pretty colourful sweets. Laduree checks all of the above with the added bonus of it all being French and delicate. Fittingly, their signature tea and macaroon flavour are called Marie Antoinette. So while you let them have cake you can get down to eating all of the yummy macaroons.The Marie Antoinette tea's main flavours are citrus and rose with a honey aftertaste. It's a strange taste at first but you get used to it and by the end you will me up loving it. The corresponding macaroon is more caramel and vanilla based so in my opinion the rose flavoured one is a much better match and my personal favourite. There is certainly a difference in flavour when you have the macaroons at the venue instead of buying the boxes. They did taste very fresh and even yummier than usually if that is even possible. Basically if you're looking for a girly afternoon with your friends you should go there.

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom

4qX2gv-fIxNgXxQg8mm0vQ.text: I've only ever bought the macaroons to take away here so can't comment on the service, but in my experience this is a great place to come for something a little bit special.There is a massive selection of delicious macaroons, and the little gift boxes make a great present.  It is a little on the pricey side, but I think it's worth it! I'd love to stop in for afternoon tea one day.

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom. Picnic with the macaroons!
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful selection

0MScULrAbebBFeWTLHxg5w.text: The desserts are AWESOME! excited to try this in London.One single costs like 1.8 pounds, but it worths the price.They also sell combo, key chains and tea, and the inner decorations are really cool and lovely

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom. mini macaroons

8F6swtLD9W9T4yLAs0B_Zw.text: There is only one reason I come to this place: macaroon! And only one flavour I always have: orange blossom. Their tea is not bad either with some Asian choices. But be prepared to cramp into a small table.

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom

sDKaC0Wt9Pr7wNV_kG63yA.text: Great location in covent garden. Beautiful tea and incredible desserts and macarons.After dinner elsewhere, came here for after dinner tea and dessert.  Every dessert was incredible. Service can be better.

FuJ_qkrUEAM9g3UdLZgiMw.text: The macaron were a nice texture and flavours we unique. It's comparable to our experience at Pierre Hermes in Paris, and maybe a smidge better? Definitely expensive though. It's a nice experience for sure. May be back next time we're in London.

1aqAtc83lajwK9ogc7BdEw.text: Perfectly situated, lovely atmosphere and excellent macaroons! I you love French pastries and desserts, especially macaroons I would put this place on the must visit list!

_ExTwueAOLS_wz0mmKQnyA.text: They survived an 11 hour flight! Thank god. I was so wanting to devour them but I just couldn't find the heart to enjoy them after eating and drinking my way through London, so decided to bring them home. They got a little beat up in my bag but overall they taste fresh and amazing as expected. They are the perfect macaron, just right in the chewy to crunchy ratio and the center filling is soft and flavorful. Favorite flavor: Rose

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom. After an 11 hour flight. Survived with only a couple cracks :)

dmVFx2I89vtBg6e4Da5NMg.text: Ladurée, among other things, is a master of macarons. Whatever other french people might say (dad, I'm thinking of you), and although Lenôtre invented them, Ladurée's ARE the best in the world. I hadn't had macarons in a while so I decide to pop in the store and try out Ladurée abroad. Gladly, it tasted the same. My favourites are lemon, rose, vanilla and raspberry but this time they had replaced the raspberry by candy raspberry and the vanilla by rum-vanilla. The first one wasn't to my taste, too marshmallowy, but the vanilla enhanced with a touch of rum was absolutely divine. if you ever get the chance, have the Ispahan. It's a big pink dessert made with a big macaron, litchi and raspeberry. It's probably one of my favourite patisserie. Regrettably they didn't have my favourite vanilla tea anymore but if you get the chance, try it on site or to take away. They sell all their teas in cute round boxes. Service was neat and precise as always.

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom

XyQCob81fUOOvK9Wnyikug.text: NY finally got its first Laduree 2 years ago but with 45min wait times and expensive prices I have yet to try a macaron from the famous place. But when my bf and I were in London recently we accidentally stumbled upon their Covent Garden store and decided to try their famous confections. I love meringue in all forms and I love macarons. My bf knows this so he's brought home macarons from various places. I must admit Laduree's macarons are quite exceptional. Specifically their pistachio macaron is stellar. I don't usually like pistachio because the flavor comes off artificial but Laduree's is excellent. I also loved the cassis macaron and the marshmallow filled ones. I'll definitely have to give in and splurge on a box once in a while.

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom

tlRPJ7a4MwW3dPLWtw0rkA.text: As a man, I hate to admit that I love macarons as much as I do. I probably like these colorful girly snacks/desserts more so than my wife. It's the texture of the airy and light cookies that sandwich flavorful fillings that I'm addicted to. As a matter of fact, these were so airy and light that some broke in the bag while I took a picture of a Covent Garden street performer just outside. If you're not going to finish your macarons, I'd suggest a box (£12.80 for a box of 8). Otherwise, they're £1.60 each. Inside, true to the Parisian cafe experience/perception, the French pastries were mesmerizing. Also true to the Parisian cafe experience/perception the worker had a snotty attitude and wouldn't explain what some of the pastries were. The person the next day was more helpful.Here's what we shared, *Caramel with sea salt - Rich complex depth. Mrs G's favorite*Strawberry candy marshmallow - (New line). Crisp, fluffy, smooth = amusing*Blackcurrant & violet - Classic *Pistachio  *Strawberry & poppy - Interesting combo *Pure origin Ghana chocolate - Deep and earthy, almost spicy cocoa flavor*Cherry blossom - interesting*Lemon - vibrant, good balance of sweet/tart*Milk chocolate *Rose petal -  Like eating potpourri, not a fanUntil I make my macaron pilgramage to Paris for Pierre Hermé, Jean-Paul Hevin, Sadaharu Aoki, etc. Laduree's macarons's are excellent and are going to be my new reference point.

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom. fantastic macarons | cherry blossom, milk chocolate, pistachio, Ghana chocolate, lemon
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom. Macaron flavors
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom. Macaron display. There's a display of French pastries to the right

J4QXRNSPK5yyhX7MrI0NJw.text: Macaron-craze is so, so dated, I know. But I still love them very much. And Ladurée definitely does some of the best this side of the Channel. So, yes, sure, they're a bit pricey, but if you're going to indulge, you might as well do it right. Just make sure you get a vanilla macaron, and a salted caramel one. And one of each of the seasonal range while you're at it ;)

aOq1wT1PyNoUjKiiSOgANQ.text: THE BEST MACARONS EVAARRR.I ordered 12 for £25 or $33 US, a little steep, I know. Each flavor was distinct and identifiable. The cookies didn't break when handled but still crumbled perfectly. And they weren't too sweet! The filling is where THE MAGIC IS AT. I don't know how they pack so much flavor into such a tiny thing but they just do. And it's fantastic.Flavor recommendations: café, lemon, and lavender..Don't buy macarons anywhere else, they'll just be disappointing in texture and flavor, but just as expensive. (I know from experience; 3 different macarons shops elsewhere in London) Wait for Ladureé, it's worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom. Box of 12, comes in blue, pink or green

BXzvLnQM9ivtn-U0f66ILw.text: Ok, this is a bucket list must ty place. The allure of Laduree is real with its Parisian chic ambiance to its colorful treats. Food: The food is typical cafe food/pastries. The macaroons were perfect. They taste light and airy with the a good balance of sweetness. I got half a dozen macaroons for about 11 pounds. My favorite flavor was the pastasio which I would defiantly recommend trying.

lh0RCKdzdSmr0HSNsnvUWA.text: Ladurée is a popular macaron chain establishment with many locations worldwide. This has to be one of my favorite locations due to :1. Location-This place has been open for many years and is just as busy as when it first opened (at least every time I visit. I love this location because you can people watch and see the street performers out front.2. Seating - Not all Ladurée locations worldwide have a cafe but this one does. The seating is limited but very Parisian and cute. 3. Decor - The decor is very cute and perfect if you have a young daughter. She would love it 4. Sentimental - This was actually the first Ladurée store I ever visited when I was younger so it holds a sentimental place in my heart. 5. Food - Truthfully I only like their macaroons and not much of anything else on their menu. Particularly I like their pistachio macaron. But their other deserts are quite pretty and popular so for sure try them at least once. Cons: 1. If you order macaroons from downstairs and try to eat them in the restaurant they offer, they will charge you an extra .50p. Ugh! 2. Renovation is highly needed. 3. Small location- My husband and I visited the cafe and he felt like he was in a doll house. Everything felt smaller to him (ceiling height, space, furniture) so he felt very cramped. He has to turn sideways due to his shoulders being too wide and even at our table count fit his legs under the table so he put them on the sides (like he had the table in an abductor press lol) This might be an issue if you have a guy with you :p. Also in the winter there isn't a lot of place to put your coat and scarves in addition to your purse. Still one of my favorite Laduree locations. Def stop by!

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom

XbovwbTlzy-M7uO_FXkNTQ.text: I've been a loyal Laduree customer for years and years. This is the most horrible one I've ever come across, and i truly believe it has gone down hill. I'm not sure if it's Bc it's in such a touristy location, so maybe they can get away with poor service and unprofessional attitudes and mediocre products, but do not come here!I popped into the shop, with a simple and quick order of 2  boxes. The girls behind the counter looked messy and tired, didn't look polished or friendly. They got my order together, no frills, no fuss, which was totally fine. The credit card machine was down, after 10 min of trying to fix it they reclaimed my macarons and said to go out into the Cold and wait in the eating area. Upstairs was full. Upon going outside, the man was annoying and got my order wrong. He was hasty and gave me a dirty cup and brought out hot chocolate instead of coffee. He was also frustrated that I had a baby stroller which wasn't inconveniencing anyone but himself. He made me take the stroller around the ways on the cobblestone which woke my baby up, everyone knows this is the most annoying thing that could possibly happen when trying to have a quick break.

ipxX2J9M3jqLB4hPG8CJkA.text: All I can say is this place is AMAZING. They have an endless selection of macaroons and desserts that will leave you wanting more. Their prices are fair and their service is quick! The tea room on the second floor is first come first serve so it is very hard to get a table for a large number of people during prime tea hours. Next time you go to Laudrée get a coconut macaroon :)

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom

mKulRwAiqKMrKslpmCgWEg.text: Landed at this place on a chilly February weekend evening for after dinner coffee and dessert. This place was packed and we had to wait 20-25 mins as we did not have a reservation. They had some outside seating with heaters, but the seating was cramped and close together. We got an inside table which was much better. Still this place offers more seating than the other Laduree location in London. It's cute and quaint place with good service. Their macaroons and desserts were fresh, coffee and hot chocolate were extraordinaire. Tried their Rose, pistachio and passion fruit macaroons - all were great. Their flavors are endless. Will not be disappointed.

VJ_SGPDLtSgBFGZuJoy-BQ.text: Came to the infamous Laduree cafe during my summer trip in London. This quaint location is inside the Convent Garden market which in itself is a much see attraction. With high end luxury shops and other shopping stores in the vicinity, it's a great location to spend the day or an afternoon. The day I went, there were street entertainers and families everywhere. I had an amazing time and I also enjoyed breakfast on the patio of Laduree, overlooking it all. The baked goods were to die for and the scrambled egg with smoked salmon was so good! The portion was larger than I expected so I obviously ordered a croissant as a side but it was all so good so no regrets there. Do come and enjoy some breakfast, plus grab some macarons to go and just have fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom

5IKS6AVSREBivAECKKGfIg.text: I do not understand why people are marking a big deal about the macaroons here...they are just fine and a bit too sugary too me...We ordered some puff and a very greasy and sugary cake (I think it was soaked in syrup and liquor)...a bit disappointed. And, the dining ware, seriously, should be renewed coz it must be ages since they were firstly introduced to this shop from the scratches and the misshaping of the paints...

UXTFiUBq-Q3gCok_n-5b6g.text: This is a great ladure in covent garden but there are so many options for various treats in the vicinity so I've only been there once!There was a wait which seemed odd to me but it's primarily tourists

Xrp3fvfRCsMpwLeMttR4tA.text: The wait was a little long because there aren't too many seats inside, but it was worth it! Three of us shared two afternoon tea sets and it was more than enough. Everything was visually pleasing, and the sweets and pastries were all amazing! Especially loves the eclair.

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon tea
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom

wp9h5TiAj15HSAEWCaMeBw.text: My best friend and I had an amazing experience at Ladurée. I've been to Ladurée in Paris, London, and New York, and every location is remarkably similar. I absolutely loved their fruit salad, latte and peach nectar. My latte was beautiful. The macaroons are unmistakably delicious and to die for. They had a special edition vanilla macaroon which was gorgeous and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom. Fruit salad was delicious
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom. :)
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom. Fruit Salad

wVU_JjfyMFt1k_0Jgz1j5g.text: Once you have a Laudree, you truly understand what the macaroon hype is all about. My absolute favorite is the Marie-Antoinette Tea flavor. It was perfectly complex with the black tea infusion, rose petal, honey and citrus notes that intrigued my pallet!This is a must stop in my travels and I have enjoyed this flavor the most. I also visited the Harrod's location but it tasted like it was sitting out for too long and the pastry was more crunchy than soft and pillowy.Definitely try a range of flavors to see what you like best!

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom. January 2016 flavors

HjftMXYzEecgy1dG9Uq6Cg.text: Laduree does have a complete menu and also serves pre/post theatre dinners. But I only head here for their macaroons.They do the most delicious macaroons I have ever tasted anywhere int he world. Delicately flavoured macaroon shells held together by an equally delicate filling, each bite is like biting into a bit of heaven.A plate of macaroons, a pot of hot tea (without sugar) and a seat at their outdoor table on a clear day is sheer bliss for me.However, on this last occasion, my sister & I picked up a box of 8 and shared it between us as we meandered across Covent Garden spacing each one at least 5 minutes apart, so as to enjoy the individual flavours.

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom. Box of heaven! Slowly savoured. . .
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom

rj44So0V03Irdl0LtXHaYQ.text: Desserts looked  really fancy and  most  of  them  tasted good but service was comparatively slow. Since  I  don't  understand French，I found it difficult to order by  just browsing the menu. If I  could  order  from  the  counter then  it  would  be  better.

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom

7_AA2pav5evtL8ojMWTS8A.text: The wait for a table is long but worth it! I love Laduree! The view from the balcony outside is pretty nice. The service is good. Laduree Macarons are the best! Rose is my favorite! There is no area for waiting and they don't put your name on a list or give you a buzzer or some other way in which you can walk around covent garden until your table is ready. I would say that was the biggest issue I had with the place. Once you get seated you can enjoy some nice macarons, tea, and champagne

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom

XofG49D2x2QkQHuULltq4Q.text: Stop by here for a cup of tea and some pastries. The staff at the front door was friendly to greet us but the server upstairs who's taking the order wasn't that friendly. Wasn't smiling at all. All the pastries was good but the furniture (the sofa and table seems old and dusty).

photos.caption: Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom

JZRW12wOkQ2KOcSSncYm8g.text: Great great store but a bit overrated.Don't order the omelette !!!!Cake is perfect.

C-6rHe25St68WBXsi75Kzg.text: Nice place to try once but not the best for afternoon tea. I give the food 4.5 stars but the service and atmosphere 4 stars. It was difficult to get the check because after we finished eating, we were left alone for a long period of time, but before that the service was more tentative. Overall the service is very friendly. The food was very good but very expensive for what it was. I'm not well versed in tea so I did not particularly enjoy the tea. The best part was my dessert. The macaron was the perfect texture with a crispy shell on the outside and soft on the inside, complimented perfectly with strawberries and raspberries. The size was perfect for two people. Don't get seated near the restroom! The door is extremely disruptive and annoying because it slams shut everything someone opens or closes it. Worst part of the whole experience. Ask to sit outside instead.

Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom. Potatoe (fries), cheese and ham sandwiches (roughly $20 pound for this small item). Sandwich was tasty, but very expensive
Photo of Laduree - London, United Kingdom. We tried the black tea and earl grey tea

5psjkHH3gCxGhxu6UXeAXg.text: If I'm ever near a Laduree I have to go. The quality is consistent no matter what location that you visit. The shop in Covent Garden is very small so you have to be quick to make your selections as it gets a little crowded. These are the best macarons I have ever had, made with the highest quality ingredients. They aren't cheap but they are completely worth it.

S7Kd6ww6R1OIJZ2A4ifmKQ.text: Horrible service I am giving it three stars because I love la duree . The stuff gets overwhelmed when it's busy our server didn't know the menu and spoke little English . I understand they speak French but it's london not Paris we need people fluent in English . I think they need a new manager cause the service was bad bad .
